metadata.title: USN-6706-1 -- Linux kernel (OEM) vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that the Microchip USB Ethernet driver in the Linux kernel contained a race condition during device removal, leading to a use- after-free vulnerability. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6706-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  linux-buildinfo-6.1.0-1036-oem - 6.1.0-1036.36 linux-headers-6.1.0-1036-oem - 6.1.0-1036.36 linux-tools-6.1.0-1036-oem - 6.1.0-1036.36 linux-image-6.1.0-1036-oem - 6.1.0-1036.36 linux-modules-iwlwifi-6.1.0-1036-oem - 6.1.0-1036.36 linux-modules-6.1.0-1036-oem - 6.1.0-1036.36 linux-modules-ipu6-6.1.0-1036-oem - 6.1.0-1036.36 linux-oem-6.1-headers-6.1.0-1036 - 6.1.0-1036.36 linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-1036-oem - 6.1.0-1036.36 linux-modules-ivsc-6.1.0-1036-oem - 6.1.0-1036.36 linux-oem-6.1-tools-host - 6.1.0-1036.36 linux-oem-6.1-tools-6.1.0-1036 - 6.1.0-1036.36 No subscription required  linux-headers-oem-22.04a - 6.1.0.1036.37 linux-headers-oem-22.04b - 6.1.0.1036.37 linux-headers-oem-22.04c - 6.1.0.1036.37 linux-modules-ivsc-oem-22.04b - 6.1.0.1036.37 linux-modules-ivsc-oem-22.04c - 6.1.0.1036.37 linux-modules-iwlwifi-oem-22.04c - 6.1.0.1036.37 linux-modules-iwlwifi-oem-22.04b - 6.1.0.1036.37 linux-image-oem-22.04a - 6.1.0.1036.37 linux-image-oem-22.04c - 6.1.0.1036.37 linux-image-oem-22.04b - 6.1.0.1036.37 linux-tools-oem-22.04c - 6.1.0.1036.37 linux-tools-oem-22.04a - 6.1.0.1036.37 linux-modules-ipu6-oem-22.04c - 6.1.0.1036.37 linux-modules-ipu6-oem-22.04b - 6.1.0.1036.37 linux-oem-22.04c - 6.1.0.1036.37 linux-oem-22.04b - 6.1.0.1036.37 linux-oem-22.04a - 6.1.0.1036.37 linux-tools-oem-22.04b - 6.1.0.1036.37 No subscription required
